name: phlegmatically
content:
Add to word list
Add to word list
in a way that does not show much emotion or excitement about things: She responded phlegmatically to the news of her father's imprisonment. The singer reacted phlegmatically to his sudden rise to fame.
More examplesFewer examplesAfter the announcement, she phlegmatically returned to her office and completed a scheduled series of meetings.Most people responded to the crisis phlegmatically, although some have expressed anger at the government's handling of it.Londoners prided themselves on phlegmatically getting through the Blitz.
